meaning: With Her powerful personality, the Divine Mother as Mahāmāya deludes the mind of even the wise (jnani).
commentary:
Māya is the individual illusion (microcosm); महा-माया (mahā-māyā) is the cosmic (universal) illusion. This Divine Mother as Goddess Mahā-māyā is seated at Haridwar. Her energy is called māyā shakti (power of illusion).

The word māyā consists of 2 alphabets Mā and Yā. The word ‘Mā’ has many meanings which include – ‘Lakshmi, prosperity, wealth, illusion (moha), ego (ahamkara), pride and useless thoughts’.

Māya has been defined as – ‘Yā मा (mā) saiva māyā’- meaning – that which supports the intoxication due to wealth and prosperity, that which causes pride and ego in the individual and that which is the root of all this illusion, is ‘māyā’.

Chandi Saptashati contains the following stanza in praise of the Divine Mother –

Jnaninām api chetānsi devi bhagawati hi sāBalāt akruśya mohāya mahāmāya prayachati.
